content: Network and Learning Group In the news Skip to primary navigation Skip to content Skip to primary sidebar Our research is on large-scale data analytics and machine learning for networks. Our research seeks real-world applications important to our society. These problems motivate new methodologies on data analytics and learning in a networked setting. Recent work includes Resilient energy networks and impact on people, Spatial temporal models for learning from micro data at scale. In collaboration with colleagues, service providers and policy makers, our research uses field data from large geographical regions in the United States. We welcome collaboration. Recent news Positions: Ph.D student(s) or one postdoc available for developing novel methodology on large-scale data analytics, modeling, and learning algorithms. The methodology will be applied to decision making for energy networks and communities. We are looking for applicants with aspiration for innovative research, a strong academic background and computational skill (or desire to develop one). Contact: jichuanyi@gatech.edu If you are already admitted by a Ph.D program at Georgia Tech, we will be happy to discuss your research interest with you.
